history.content: I think it's a reasonable expectation that time zone conflicts will be accommodated even if alternate finals are not

A lot of CS classes are not allowing time conflict enrollment due to not having alternative exams. Does that mean that those classes will not have accommodation for people living in different time zones? From what I heard, the reason behind that is a new l&s policy mandating alternative exams for professors offering time conflict enrollment, but the accommodations needed for conflicting exams are very much the same from the accommodations needed for alternative time zones, and since professors are not willing to accommodate conflicting exams, can we deduce that they are also not willing to accommodate people in different time zones.
history.subject: Time Conflict Enrollment and Alternative Exams
